Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery 'overlap' Siana cup; glaze fired red; interior glazed; exterior: narrow black band at top of lip; below, black-figure decoration consisting of female figure (top of head and ear remaining), to left and a flying bird.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Brijder attributes the sherd to the Malibu Painter's Middle Period.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 87 no. 294 pl. 66)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 373, no. B508, pl. XXVI, pl. CLXXXVIII)
Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (p. 724, Add. no. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1321) (phase 3)
